sentence.Network_en: Holmes was gregarious, a great wit, a man of wide interests.
sentence.Network_cn: 福尔摩斯爱交际，非常风趣，兴趣广泛。

sentence.Network_en: Rodney was a cheerful, elegant and gregarious if rather contentious man.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗德尼尽管非常喜欢与人争辩，却是个阳光、优雅、合群的人。

sentence.Network_en: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.
sentence.Network_cn: 她很外向，喜欢交朋结友。

合群人格(gregarious personality) 时间:2013-02-23来源:深圳心荷心理咨询公司打印本文喜好交际、希望获得别人注意和好感的人格特征。很多正常人格、癔症性人格、.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Latin gregarius (from grex, greg- 'a flock') + -ous

entry.def: Someone who is gregarious enjoys being with other people.

example.ex: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.
example.tran: 她很外向，喜欢交朋结友。

entry.def: Gregarious animals or birds normally live in large groups.

example.ex: Snow geese are very gregarious birds.

means.word_mean: 1. tending to form a group with others of the same kind;
2. seeking and enjoying the company of others;

auth_sentence.content: He is more gregarious; she is more reserved.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is more gregarious; she is more reserved.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is more gregarious; she is more reserved.

auth_sentence.content: Strindberg in his gregarious way was to enjoy many...contacts.

auth_sentence.content: Normally gregarious, he sat alone in virtual silence.

stems_affixes.word_buile: g增加+greg群体+ate……的→adj.合计的, 集合的
con一起+greg集合+ate……的→集合到一起→聚集的
e出+greg群体+ious……的→除了一般的团体→过分的
ag加强+greg群体+ation表名词→n.聚集,总合

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分离,隔离;种族差别待遇
stems_affixes.word_buile: segregate[v.隔离]+ion表名词→n.分离,隔离;种族差别待遇
dis分开+aggregate聚合→聚合的东西分开
se分开+greg群+ate使……→使……和人群分开→隔离

sentences.cn: 这些动物非常喜欢群居。
